item.title: 4" deep and large..in road and now impacting on our drive and many cars hitting it, 28th February
item.description:
Outside our property Todpool Cottage, The Leigh issue has been present for months but has not been marked when highways came round
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmiths Lane, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose metal drain cover in road rocks & bangs each time a vehicle passes over it. The volume has increased & I think that the range of movement has increased to match, there may come a point when it fails. I can hear it clearly day & night at the end of Chatsworth Drive, those living closer must really be disturbed by the constant noise. Also, as the movement increases the likelihood that it will become more of a hazard, damage car tyres or unseating cyclists becomes more likely., 28th February
item.description:
Drain cover in Leckhampton Road, in the southbound/up hill lane immediately by the end of Chatsworth Drive.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 196, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole on crest of hill up to cooper's hill, 28th February
item.description:
The pothole was previously reported and marked as resolved. it has not been fixed and remains an issue. this pothole is very deep and has become a hazard to those driving up the hill, as it's not immediately visible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on side of road on crest of hill up to cooper's, 28th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sussex Avenue, Rowanfield, Cheltenham

item.title: There is a pothole more than 10 inches deep on Whittington Road that caused my car tyre to burst. The hole is extremely large and deep — the worst I have ever seen. Because cars are parked on both sides of the road, it is impossible to avoid driving through it. As a result, three tyres have burst due to this pothole. This is a serious safety hazard and needs urgent repair., 28th February
item.description:
Whittington road Near to gloucester road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole increasingly dangerous and growing daily, 28th February
item.description:
Directly as you turn left from Tewkesbury Road into Elm Street. This pothole has been increasing in size and you can now see beige surface where tarmac has been worn down. Large amount of displaced grit/stone on highway from the crumbling.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elm Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No yellow lines, 28th February
item.description:
Junction of Francis Street & Exmouth Street, since recently resurfacing this area the yellow lines on this awkward junction have not been restored. Careless parking here now makes navigating difficult, on a corner where five roads join. An accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple pot holes in main carriageway, 28th February
item.description:
At the end of Tone Drive as you turn left or right into Wye Road there are multiple pot holes some deeper than others. You had a team of road workers out on Thursday but it seems they may have only bothered filling one pot hole. The road surface is failing in it’s current state.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wye Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree outside of my house which was causing subsidence to my property was felled and plugged at the stump is now regrowing. I have contacted many times to report this and nothing has been done., 28th February
